criterion: Provides information on how to treat blisters at home.
Mentions the importance of keeping the blister clean and dry.
Suggests popping the blister, which is not recommended.
Does not mention the risk of infection associated with blisters.
Asks the user if they have any questions or concerns.
Uses clear and concise language to explain blister treatment.
Does not provide alternative treatment options beyond using moleskin.
Mentions the importance of seeking medical attention if the blister becomes infected.
Does not provide any information on how to prevent blisters from forming in the future.
Provides information on how to drain a blister safely.
Does not mention the importance of seeking medical attention for people with certain health conditions.
Provides information on how to relieve blister-related pain.
Does not provide any information on how to prevent blisters from becoming infected.
Provides information on how to apply moleskin to a blister.
Does not mention the importance of keeping the blister area clean and dry.
Provides information on how to treat blisters in people with diabetes or poor circulation.
Does not provide any information on how to treat blisters in children.
